milestone.title: stable release (1.0.0-rc.1)
milestone.description:
Motivation: libsecp is already widely used today, but often in a terribly outdated version. It's likely that a release process would help with that. Moreover, it simplifies using libsecp which may prevent developers from using less well tested alternatives. Lastly, without releases it's difficult to update the library in an organized fashion and communicate these updates.

Release Goals:

- Stabilize API and documentation for functionality that exist today.
- Fix a few known bugs.
- Make ECDH non-experimental.

This milestone can be discussed in issue https://github.com/bitcoin-core/secp256k1/issues/286.

repo.name: secp256k1
repo.description: Optimized C library for EC operations on curve secp256k1

repo.name: secp256k1
repo.description: Optimized C library for EC operations on curve secp256k1

events.message: Add visibility hidden attribute to non-MSVC statics, rebase.
Rename static export helpers and public export symbol, export extern vars.
Export ecdh, recovery and schnorr APIs.

events.body: I prefer the readability of the gcc example layout, and the use of `dllimport`, but not a big deal in either case.
@gmaxwell #314 looks like a subset of this one. With the except GCC visibility is not set to hidden by default here.

This defines SECP256K1_STATIC and SECP256K1_EXPORT, but they aren't being set anywhere?

If in #314, in the non-SECP256K1_BUILD branch for windows, declspec(dllimport) is set rather than nothing, do we get the best of both worlds?
I also think that this fails to set dllexport/import when compiling with MinGW?

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -40,6 +40,26 @@ extern "C" {
 #  define SECP256K1_ARG_NONNULL(_x)
 # endif
 
+# if defined _MSC_VER || defined __CYGWIN__
+#  define SECP256K1_HELPER_DLL_IMPORT __declspec(dllimport)
+#  define SECP256K1_HELPER_DLL_EXPORT __declspec(dllexport)
+# else
+#  if __GNUC__ >= 4
+#   define SECP256K1_HELPER_DLL_IMPORT __attribute__ ((visibility ("default")))
+#   define SECP256K1_HELPER_DLL_EXPORT __attribute__ ((visibility ("default")))
+#  else
+#   define SECP256K1_HELPER_DLL_IMPORT
+#   define SECP256K1_HELPER_DLL_EXPORT
+#  endif
+# endif
+
+# if defined SECP256K1_STATIC
+#  define SECP256K1_API
+# elif defined SECP256K1_DLL
comments.body: CMake has a convention to add macro `MyLibrary_EXPORTS` when building a DLL. Is it possible to rename `SECP256K1_DLL` to `SECP256K1_EXPORTS`?

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -40,6 +40,26 @@ extern "C" {
 #  define SECP256K1_ARG_NONNULL(_x)
 # endif
 
+# if defined _MSC_VER || defined __CYGWIN__
+#  define SECP256K1_HELPER_DLL_IMPORT __declspec(dllimport)
+#  define SECP256K1_HELPER_DLL_EXPORT __declspec(dllexport)

+#   define SECP256K1_HELPER_DLL_EXPORT __attribute__ ((visibility ("default")))
+#  else

+#   define SECP256K1_HELPER_DLL_EXPORT
+#  endif

comments.body:
Sounds good to me.

I think this should be `__attribute__ ((visibility ("hidden")))` in the `SECP256K1_STATIC` case though, since it wouldn't need to be externally visible

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -40,6 +40,26 @@ extern "C" {
 #  define SECP256K1_ARG_NONNULL(_x)
 # endif
 
+# if defined _MSC_VER || defined __CYGWIN__
+#  define SECP256K1_HELPER_DLL_IMPORT __declspec(dllimport)
comments.body: dllimport is only useful in case of global variables and C++ classes, not in case of functions. Removing dllimport support would simplify the patch.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -40,6 +40,26 @@ extern "C" {
 #  define SECP256K1_ARG_NONNULL(_x)
 # endif
 
+# if defined _MSC_VER || defined __CYGWIN__
+#  define SECP256K1_HELPER_DLL_IMPORT __declspec(dllimport)
+#  define SECP256K1_HELPER_DLL_EXPORT __declspec(dllexport)
+# else
+#  if __GNUC__ >= 4
+#   define SECP256K1_HELPER_DLL_IMPORT __attribute__ ((visibility ("default")))
+#   define SECP256K1_HELPER_DLL_EXPORT __attribute__ ((visibility ("default")))
+#  else
+#   define SECP256K1_HELPER_DLL_IMPORT
+#   define SECP256K1_HELPER_DLL_EXPORT
+#  endif
+# endif
+
+# if defined SECP256K1_STATIC
+#  define SECP256K1_API
+# elif defined SECP256K1_DLL
comments.body:
Good idea...

``` c
    define SECP256K1_HELPER_DLL_EXPORT __declspec(dllexport)
else
    if __GNUC__ >= 4
        define SECP256K1_HELPER_DLL_IMPORT __attribute__ ((visibility ("default")))
        define SECP256K1_HELPER_DLL_EXPORT __attribute__ ((visibility ("default")))
        define SECP256K1_HELPER_STATIC __attribute__ ((visibility ("hidden")))
    else
        define SECP256K1_HELPER_DLL_IMPORT
        define SECP256K1_HELPER_DLL_EXPORT
        define SECP256K1_HELPER_STATIC
    endif
endif

if defined SECP256K1_STATIC
    define SECP256K1_API SECP256K1_HELPER_STATIC
elif defined SECP256K1_DLL
```

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -40,6 +40,26 @@ extern "C" {
 #  define SECP256K1_ARG_NONNULL(_x)
 # endif
 
+# if defined _MSC_VER || defined __CYGWIN__
+#  define SECP256K1_HELPER_DLL_IMPORT __declspec(dllimport)
comments.body:
I'm not sure this is the case. This is an old reference, but I have to assume it still holds:

> You do not need to use __declspec(dllimport) for your code to compile correctly, but doing so allows the compiler to generate better code.

https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/aa271769(v=vs.60).aspx

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -131,6 +131,30 @@ typedef int (*secp256k1_nonce_function_t)(
 #  define SECP256K1_ARG_NONNULL(_x)
 # endif
 
+# if defined _MSC_VER || defined __CYGWIN__
+#  define SECP256K1_HELPER_LOCAL
+#  define SECP256K1_HELPER_DLL_IMPORT __declspec(dllimport)
+#  define SECP256K1_HELPER_DLL_EXPORT __declspec(dllexport)
+# else
+#  if __GNUC__ >= 4
+#   define SECP256K1_HELPER_LOCAL      __attribute__ ((visibility ("hidden")))
+#   define SECP256K1_HELPER_DLL_IMPORT __attribute__ ((visibility ("default")))
+#   define SECP256K1_HELPER_DLL_EXPORT __attribute__ ((visibility ("default")))
+#  else
+#   define SECP256K1_HELPER_LOCAL
+#   define SECP256K1_HELPER_DLL_IMPORT
+#   define SECP256K1_HELPER_DLL_EXPORT
+#  endif
+# endif
+
+# if defined SECP256K1_STATIC
+#  define SECP256K1_API SECP256K1_HELPER_LOCAL
+# elif defined SECP256K1_EXPORTS
+#  define SECP256K1_API SECP256K1_HELPER_DLL_EXPORT
+# else
+#  define SECP256K1_API SECP256K1_HELPER_DLL_IMPORT
+# endif
+
comments.body: The above matches closely the [GCC example](https://gcc.gnu.org/wiki/Visibility) (bottom of page). There is deviation in the public symbols `SECP256K1_STATIC` and `SECP256K1_EXPORTS`. The latter is modified for better CMake integration (see [comment](https://github.com/bitcoin/secp256k1/pull/223#discussion_r39398451) by @chfast). WRT the former I consider "static" more explicit than "local" and therefore better for publication.
I have not had a chance to verify these two lines, but according to documentation it appears correct for both VC and GCC.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -40,6 +40,26 @@ extern "C" {
 #  define SECP256K1_ARG_NONNULL(_x)
 # endif
 
+# if defined _MSC_VER || defined __CYGWIN__
+#  define SECP256K1_HELPER_DLL_IMPORT __declspec(dllimport)
comments.body: @evoskuil, you are right. I've checked the Visual Studio 2013 and it generates better code when dllimport is used (as described in the article).
